decks.notes: The main strategy of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with aggressive creatures like Knight of Grace and Resplendent Angel, supported by powerful anthem effects from cards like Lyra Dawnbringer and History of Benalia. Shalai, Voice of Plenty provides protection for key creatures, while Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice boosts the team's power and provides additional combat tricks. Removal spells like Lightning Strike and Deafening Clarion help clear the way for attacks, while Conclave Tribunal offers versatile removal. Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants provides additional support and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Nicol Bolas, the Ravager. By controlling the board with cards like Vraska's Contempt, Ritual of Soot, and Essence Scatter, the player can dictate the pace of the game and disrupt their opponent's strategy. Search for Azcanta and Notion Rain provide card advantage and help to filter through the deck for key cards. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control elements and strong finishers.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and powerful buffs. By quickly establishing a board presence with Weenie White creatures like Benalish Marshal and Knight of Grace, and enhancing them with cards like History of Benalia and Lyra Dawnbringer, you can apply pressure early on. Cards like Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice and Siege-Gang Commander provide additional threats, while removal spells like Justice Strike and Conclave Tribunal help control the board. The deck aims to maintain tempo and push for a decisive victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Viashino Pyromancer, along with powerful spells such as Shock and Lightning Strike, this deck aims to deal damage efficiently and clear the opponent's board. Cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy provide additional value and card advantage, while Risk Factor can pressure the opponent into making difficult choices. Overall, this deck focuses on a fast-paced, aggressive strategy to win the game quickly.

The main idea behind this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Legion's Landing and Swiftblade Vindicator, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on. Cards like History of Benalia and Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice provide additional power and synergy to further overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Lightning Strike and Justice Strike for removal and Tajic, Legion's Edge for protection, making it a well-rounded aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard synergies to quickly build board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. By using cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Glowspore Shaman to fill the graveyard, the player can easily bring back creatures like Molderhulk and Izoni, Thousand-Eyed. The deck also includes removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Plaguecrafter to deal with opposing threats. Ultimately, the goal is to outpace the opponent and secure victory through aggressive attacks and efficient resource management.

The main strategy of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the board through counterspells, removal spells, and sweepers, while also generating card advantage with draw spells like Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta. The deck aims to stall the game until it can drop powerful threats like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Niv-Mizzet, Parun, and Ral, Izzet Viceroy to close out the game. It utilizes a mix of direct damage, board wipes, counterspells, and card draw to outvalue and outgrind the opponent in a long game while maintaining control over the board.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with low-cost creatures and protecting them with counter spells and protection spells. By playing efficient creatures with evasion abilities like Mist-Cloaked Herald and Tempest Djinn, along with card draw from Curious Obsession, the deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly. The inclusion of spell counters and protection cards like Siren Stormtamer and Dive Down helps to maintain board presence and protect key creatures. Additionally, the deck utilizes tempo plays with cards like Merfolk Trickster and Exclusion Mage to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and maintaining card advantage. It utilizes a combination of counterspells like Syncopate and Sinister Sabotage, removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Cast Down, and card draw with Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta. The win condition comes from the powerful planeswalker Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and the indestructible Chromium, the Mutable. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while slowly building up to a dominant position on the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to deploy a fast and aggressive strategy by utilizing the early game mana acceleration from Llanowar Elves and powerful creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes graveyard recursion with cards like Gruesome Menagerie and Memorial to Folly to maintain board presence and generate value. The Golgari color combination allows for a mix of creature removal and powerful late-game threats like Izoni, Thousand-Eyed and Doom Whisperer to close out games efficiently.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's plays while generating card advantage through card draw and removal spells. By utilizing counter spells, board wipes, and versatile removal options, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually win the game with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Ral, Izzet Viceroy. Additionally, the deck has a strong mana base to support its triple-color requirements and aims to control the game flow until it can close out the game with a big spell like Expansion / Explosion.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using cheap creatures and spells. With a low mana curve and powerful cards like Curious Obsession, Mist-Cloaked Herald, and Tempest Djinn, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage quickly. Counterspells like Wizard's Retort and Essence Scatter help protect your creatures while cards like Dive Down and Siren Stormtamer provide additional protection. The deck relies on tempo and card advantage to outpace the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By efficiently dealing damage to the opponent's life total early in the game, it aims to maintain pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. With a low mana curve and efficient removal spells, the deck seeks to maintain tempo and control the pace of the game. Additionally, cards like Experimental Frenzy and Risk Factor provide additional card advantage and burn damage to help finish off the opponent.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast, direct damage spells and aggressive creatures. By efficiently burning through the opponent's life total while maintaining board presence, the deck aims to win before the opponent can stabilize. The key strategy is to play low cost creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Viashino Pyromancer to chip away at the opponent's life points, while also utilizing powerful burn spells like Shock and Lightning Strike to deal direct damage and clear the way for attacking creatures. Rekindling Phoenix and Risk Factor provide additional late-game threats and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively with low-cost spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing burn spells like Shock, Lightning Strike, and Wizard's Lightning, along with efficient creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Goblin Chainwhirler, this deck aims to control the board and finish off the opponent quickly. The Flame of Keld is used to pump up creatures and draw more burn spells, while Runaway Steam-Kin and Risk Factor provide additional value and pressure. This deck is all about fast, effective aggression to overpower the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Selesnya color combination to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. It capitalizes on generating token creatures and buffing them with cards like History of Benalia and Venerated Loxodon. The inclusion of cards like March of the Multitudes and Emmara, Soul of the Accord help to create a wide board presence. Additionally, cards like Shalai, Voice of Plenty and Trostani Discordant provide protection and lifegain to sustain the aggro strategy. Conclave Tribunal and Knight of Autumn serve as versatile removal and disruption cards to control the board.
